event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: The platform administrator should investigate the cause of the boot problem and schedule a service action, if necessary. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: Failure to boot Solaris on a domain via GbE.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
Failure to boot Solaris on a domain using Gigabit Ethernet.
 
This message is informational in nature and not a diagnosis.

The OpenBoot PROM fcode did not detect any fault with the device
and the XSCF software was unable to determine cause.

The domain drops to the OpenBoot PROM 'ok' prompt.

Potential causes may include, but are not limited to the following:

   Poor cable connection;
   Corrupted boot image;
   Boot server not available;
   Network problems;
   Attempting to boot from the wrong device;
   Device path missing;
   Path to device is deconfigured;
   Difficult to diagnose hardware issues.



If you require further assistance, proceed with the steps below.


       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):

   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:12:25 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: 84889ad4-fb85-41dc-ba8a-67ac4e621615
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8002-CY for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8002-CY, TYPE: Upset, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:12:25 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 84889ad4-fb85-41dc-ba8a-67ac4e621615
   DESC: Failure to boot Solaris on a domain via GbE.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8002-CY for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: Nothing is deconfigured.
   IMPACT: The domain drops to the OpenBoot PROM 'ok' prompt.
   REC-ACTION: The platform administrator should investigate the cause of the boot
   problem and schedule a service action, if necessary.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command
   

   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u 84889ad4-fb85-41dc-ba8a-67ac4e621615

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 20 21:12:25.5355 84889ad4-fb85-41dc-ba8a-67ac4e621615 SCF-8002-CY
           100%  upset.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.io.pci.gbe.boot

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/iou=0/pcislot=0/ioua=0/pci_br=0/gbe=0
                    Affects: -
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                             server-id=san-ff2-21-0/component=/IOU#0/PCI#0/IOUA



Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The domain drops to the OpenBoot PROM 'ok' prompt.
event_registry_properties.name: response
